page.title: 04NAME THAT PIER
page.content: The Sir John Ross Pier was built beside the East Pier in 1979 to service the ever increasing ferry trade. A schools competition was held to name the new pier. A class from our school, Sheuchan Primary, named the pier and received a trip on The Galloway Princess as a prize. Admiral Sir John Ross was an Arctic explorer who, to remind him of his travels in exploration of the North West Passage, named his home the North West Castle. Built in 1820 it is now a hotel but its links with him have been carefully preserved.
